externalDocs.description: find out more about wechat's web-apis

info.description: this zero-dependency package will provide a swagger-client for wechat's web-apis, with a working web-demo
info.title: swgg-wechat

appid.required.description: Official Account ID. Specifies Official Account ID assigned by WeChat.
appid.required.name: appid

attach.description: Additional Data. Allow vendors an additional field to be returned in the payment notification after submitting a payment to the Query Order API.
attach.name: attach

auth_code.required.description: Authorization Code. Specifies authorization code for scanning a barcode/QR Code on Quick Pay. Note: The WeChat barcodes are constructed with 18 numbers, with the start value of 10, 11, 12, 13, 14 or 15.
auth_code.required.name: auth_code

date.required.description: Date. In the format of yyyyMMdd. For example, December 25, 2009 is expressed as 20091225 in the time zone (GMT+8).
date.required.name: date

detail.description: Items Details. Detailed product list described in JSON format. Please use CDATA tag to protect the JSON string when generating signature.
detail.name: detail

device_info.description:
Device ID. Specifies terminal device ID assigned by WeChat Payment (such as store number as defined by the vendor).
Note: If the payment is performed based on PC web page or WeChat Web-based page, please submit the field value as WEB.
device_info.name: device_info

fee_type.required.description: Currency Type. ISO-4217 standard compliant and be described by three characters based code.
fee_type.required.name: fee_type

goods_tag.description: Item Label. Specifies label of goods, which is a parameter in the coupon feature for businesses.
goods_tag.name: goods_tag

mch_id.required.description: Vendor ID. Specifies vendor ID assigned by WeChat Payment.
mch_id.required.name: mch_id

notify_url.required.description: Notification URL. Specifies callback address for receiving WeChat payment notifications.
notify_url.required.name: notify_url

out_refund_no.required.description: Specifies the internal refund number, which is unique in the system. A single transaction can be processed as multiple partial refunds, with the total sum of the partial refunds being equal to the original one.
out_refund_no.required.name: out_refund_no

out_trade_no.required.description: Vendor Order Number. Specifies internal order number created by the Vendor’s system.
out_trade_no.required.name: out_trade_no

refund_fee.required.description: Refund Amount. Specifies the total refund amount for a transaction. The units are expressed in cents and shall be an integer.
refund_fee.required.name: refund_fee

refund_fee_type.description: Currency Type. ISO-4217 standard compliant and be described by three characters based code. The refund currency type must be same with the bid currency type.
refund_fee_type.name: refund_fee_type

return_code.required.description: Return Status Code. SUCCESS or FAIL. Specifies communicating label instead of transaction label. The status of a transaction is determined by the value oftrade_state.
return_code.required.name: return_code

return_msg.description:
Return Data. If not empty, this is the error description
Signature failure
Parameter format checking error
return_msg.name: return_msg

sign_type.description: Sign type. Currently HMAC-SHA256 and MD5 are supported, default is MD5. This parameter must be submitted if HMAC-SHA256 is chosen.
sign_type.name: sign_type

spbill_create_ip.required.description: Terminal IP. Specifies machine IP that calls the WeChat Payment API.
spbill_create_ip.required.name: spbill_create_ip

sub_appid.description: Sub Official Account ID. Specifies Sub Official Account ID assigned by WeChat.
sub_appid.name: sub_appid

sub_mch_id.required.description: Sub Vendor ID. Specifies Sub vendor ID assigned by WeChat Payment.
sub_mch_id.required.name: sub_mch_id

time.description: Specifies the transaction creation time in the format yyyyMMddHHmmss, such as 20091225091010 for Dec 25, 2009 09:10:10 (UTC+08).
time.name: time

total_fee.required.description: Bid price. Specifies total order amount. The units are expressed in cents as integers.
total_fee.required.name: total_fee

transaction_id.required.description: WeChat Order Number. Specifies WeChat payment order id number.
transaction_id.required.name: transaction_id

wechatPayApiKey.description: This key is created for transaction signatures and is retained in the Vendor’s backend and WeChat payment system, and should not be made available publicly or on the Internet. The Vendor should keep this key secured and avoid disclosing it to others. Vendors may configure the key according to the email instructions.
wechatPayApiKey.name: key

post.description:
Close Order.

This API needs to be called before a vendor wants to create a new order due to the Payer failing to pay for an order. The original order will be closed in order to avoid repeat payment. After an order is created in the WeChat payment system, if the Payer doesn't pay within the required time, no further operation can be performed in the system. To prevent the Payer from proceeding with their order, this API is called to close the order.

Download Transaction History.

This API is used to help the Vendors download their transaction record history including missing orders, and can be used to find unmatched data between vendors and WeChat caused by system error. By downloading transaction history and doing Reconciliation, the Vendor can correct the status of their orders in a timely fashion.

parameters.description: Reconciliation Start Date. Specifies date of the transactions to be downloaded in the format of yyyymmdd, such as 20140603 for June 3, 2014.
parameters.name: bill_date

parameters.description:
Bill Type.
ALL: Return all order data from the specified date. bill_type is set to ALL by default.
SUCCESS: Return successfully paid orders only.
REFUND: Return refunded orders only.
parameters.name: bill_type

parameters.description: Compress Type. Fixed value: GZIP. It will return a .gzip package if this parameter is set, unless it will return the data flow.
parameters.name: tar_type

post.description:
Submit Quick Pay.

After the Cashier scans a bar or QR code on the Quick Pay page shown by the Payer, the payment parameters are transferred to the Vendor’s backend. The Vendor’s backend calls the Submit Quick Pay API to initiate a payment.

Query Order.

This API allows inquiry of all payment orders made from WeChat. After receiving a status code using this API, vendors can proceed with the next step in service logic. The following are situations when to use the Query Order API: 1. The Vendor doesn’t receive any payment due to an exception in the Vendor's backend, network or server; 2. A system error or unknown transaction status is returned after calling the payment interface; 3. USERPAYING status is returned after calling the Quick Pay API; 4. To confirm payment status before calling the Close Order API or Revoke Order API;

Query Order.

This API allows inquiry of all payment orders made from WeChat. After receiving a status code using this API, vendors can proceed with the next step in service logic. The following are situations when to use the Query Order API: 1. The Vendor doesn’t receive any payment due to an exception in the Vendor's backend, network or server; 2. A system error or unknown transaction status is returned after calling the payment interface; 3. USERPAYING status is returned after calling the Quick Pay API; 4. To confirm payment status before calling the Close Order API or Revoke Order API;

Query Exchange Rate.

The interface could inquiry the exchange rate which Wechat Payment used in real time. The rate is updated once each day at 10 a.m. in the time zone (GMT+8).

Query Refund.

After submitting Submit Refund, this API can be called to check the refund status. After submitting a refund, there may be a delay in processing the refund: 20 minutes for refunding to Balance and 3 working days for refunding to a bank card.

Query Refund.

After submitting Submit Refund, this API can be called to check the refund status. After submitting a refund, there may be a delay in processing the refund: 20 minutes for refunding to Balance and 3 working days for refunding to a bank card.

parameters.description:
WeChat Refund Number. This field will supply the refund_id, out_refund_no, out_trade_no, or transaction_id. Their priority is as shown below:

refund_id>out_refund_no>transaction_id>o ut_trade_no.
parameters.name: refund_id

post.description:
Query Refund.

After submitting Submit Refund, this API can be called to check the refund status. After submitting a refund, there may be a delay in processing the refund: 20 minutes for refunding to Balance and 3 working days for refunding to a bank card.

Querying Dettled Funds.

This API helps query the details of settled funds.

parameters.description:
Settlement Status. Indicates the fund has been settled or is still outstanding:
1 - settled.
2 - outstanding.
parameters.name: usetag

post.description:
Unified Order.

For scenarios other than the Quick Pay method, the Vendor’s backend calls this API to create an advance transaction in the WeChat payment service backend, and initiates the payment process via payment by QR Code. JSAPI, App and other payment methods after the order is submitted successfully.

parameters.description: Transaction Type. Set to JSAPI, NATIVE, or APP.
parameters.name: trade_type

parameters.description: Product ID. This field is only required when trade_type is NATIVE. This ID contains the product ID as set by the Vendor.
parameters.name: product_id

parameters.description:
User Tag. This field is only required when trade_type is JSAPI. It is the only user identification under the current appid. About how to get openid, please refer to
http://admin.wechat.com/wiki/index.php ?title=User_Profile_via_Web
parameters.name: openid

parameters.description: Sub User Tag. This field is only required when trade_type is JSAPI. It is the only user identification under the current appid. Choose one of openid or sub_openid to submit, if sub_openid is chosen, sub_appid also need to be submitted.
parameters.name: sub_openid

post.description:
Report Speed Testing.

This API is used to assist the Vendors in improving overall service quality when they call the WeChat payment APIs. With this API, vendors obtain relevant returned data and response duration. Based on the Vendor's uplink network speed, the WeChat payment system optimizes its networking deployment, so as to continuously improve service reliability and speed.

parameters.description:
Interface URL. Complete interface URL to be reported is similar to the following:
https://api.mch.weixin.qq.com/pay/unifiedorder

When Quick Pay is used, in order to analyze the overall duration of a single service with vendors, WeChat requires a report for each Quick Pay service call made in either mode 1 or mode 2. The report URL is as below:
https://api.mch.weixin.qq.com/pay/micropay/total

For other payment methods, calling and reporting is only required once.
parameters.name: interface_url

parameters.description: API Execute Duration. Specifies the duration for calling the API. The units are expressed in milliseconds.
parameters.name: execute_tim

parameters.description: Error Code. ORDERNOTEXIST: Order does not exist.
parameters.name: err_code

parameters.description: Error Code Description. Describes result data.
parameters.name: err_code_des

parameters.description: Access Interface IP. Specifies the machine IP used when calling this interface.
parameters.name: user_ip

post.description:
Submit Refund.

For a period after a payment transaction has been completed and a refund is required by either the Payer or Vendor, the Vendor can refund the Payer via this API. After the WeChat payment system receives and verifies the refund request successfully, the Payer will be refunded with the request refund amount (less than or equal to the original payment amount) according to the refund rules.

Submit Refund.

For a period after a payment transaction has been completed and a refund is required by either the Payer or Vendor, the Vendor can refund the Payer via this API. After the WeChat payment system receives and verifies the refund request successfully, the Payer will be refunded with the request refund amount (less than or equal to the original payment amount) according to the refund rules.

Revoke Order.

When a payment transaction isn't successfully returned or the payment system times out, this API is called to cancel the transaction. After revoking, the successful order will be refunded, while the failed order will be closed.

Short URL Conversion.

This API is used for the URL embedded in a QR code when using native payment method 1 and converts it into short URL (weixin://wxpay/s/XXXXXX), so as to reduce data volume, speed up scanning, and improve accuracy.

parameters.description: Long URL. Specifies the URL to be converted. The signature keeps original string and uses URL encode for transferring data.
parameters.name: long_url

post.description:
General Payment Result Notification.

After completing a payment, the WeChat payment system will send the relevant payment result and user information to the Vendor. When this happens, the Vendor’s backend will need to receive the result and return a reply to the WeChat payment system.

wechat-pay.description: find out more about wechat-pay's web-apis
